0.title: West Virginia Anti-hazing Law
0.description: 10.0pt;color:windowtext'>The purpose of this bill is to extend the prohibition against hazing to any organization whose members are primarily students or alumni of an institution of higher education.

1.title: Authorizing the West Virginia Board of Physical Therapy to conduct criminal background checks on applicants
1.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Board of Physical Therapy to request criminal background checks of applicants for initial licensure by the board and to establish conditions for the handling of the resulting information.

2.title: Relating generally to medical cannabis
2.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the limitations on permits for growers, processors and dispensaries of medical cannabis. The bill increases the number of permits that the bureau may issue for growers, processors and dispensaries of medical cannabis. The bill permits growers, processors and dispensaries to be the same person or entity. The bill defines and modifies terms; modifies conditions for issuance of patient certifications; and requires that one or more state residents own a majority of a medical cannabis business entity. The bill imposes an excise tax on dispensaries of medical cannabis measured by the gross receipts from such sales, and provides for the administration, collection and enforcement of the tax. In addition to exempting sales of medical cannabis from sales tax, the bill exempts sales from district excises taxes imposed by a county or municipality and from local sales taxes. The bill provides for the state to defend and indemnify state officials and employees acting within the scope of their employment when implementing the act.

3.title: Relating to the Upper Kanawha Valley Resiliency and Revitalization Program
3.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the definition of Upper Kanawha Valley, to extend the Upper Kanawha Valley Resiliency and Revitalization Program to June 30, 2024, and to provide that the annual report due under the program shall be delivered to the Joint Committee on Government and Finance with copies being provided to the county commissions and mayors of the Upper Kanawha Valley.

4.title: Relating to state purchasing generally
4.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit persons purchasing commodities and services on behalf of a governmental entity from having an interest in entities selling or contracting to sell commodities or services to a governmental entity; prohibit persons purchasing commodities or services on behalf of a governmental entity from accepting anything of value from persons selling, attempting to sell, or contracting to sell commodities or services to a governmental entity; prohibit persons or entities attempting to sell or selling commodities to a governmental entity from offering anything of value to the person acting as a governmental entity’s agent; prohibit delivery and acceptance of inferior commodities or services, authorizing change orders made in good faith from prohibited conduct; create exceptions to prohibited conduct consistent with state ethics law; and establish criminal penalties

5.title: Relating to regulation of recovery residences
5.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the voluntary certification of recovery residences.

6.title: Relating counseling in a medication-assisted treatment program
6.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit trained nurses, nurse practitioners, and specially trained physician assistants to provide mental health services in a medication-assisted treatment program.

7.title: Establishing health professionals’ student loan programs
7.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish health professionals’ student loan programs to encourage mental health service providers and primary care physicians to practice in the state.

8.title: Relating to refunds of excise taxes collected from dealers of petroleum products
8.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the cap on the amount of tax that may be refunded to a dealer of petroleum products for gallons lost due to evaporation.

9.title: Relating generally to the personal income tax
9.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a reducing modification to the West Virginia adjusted gross income of a shareholder of a Subchapter S corporation, or member of a limited liability company, engaged in banking business in this state and making the modification retroactive with respect to tax years beginning on or after January 1, 2018.

10.title: Establishing tax incentive for new business activity in qualified opportunity zones
10.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a decreasing modification for personal income tax and corporation net income tax for income derived from businesses activity in qualified opportunity zones in West Virginia.

11.title: Relating generally to court actions in abuse and neglect proceedings
11.description: The purpose of this bill is related to the appointment of counsel and general changes in abuse and neglect proceedings.

12.title: Relating generally to persons eighteen years of age and older in the custody of the Bureau of Juvenile Services
12.description: The purpose of this bill is to require notices be given to relevant courts and judicial authorities when a person originally under the custody of the Bureau for Juvenile Services, but charged under the adult jurisdiction of the courts, attains the age of 18 and to provide for designated units to house such offenders out of sight and sound of juvenile detainees and adult inmates.

13.title: Relating to reduced rates for low-income residential customers of privately owned sewer and combined water and sewer utilities
13.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide reduced rates for low-income residential customers of privately-owned water, sewer or combined water and sewer utilities.

14.title: Relating to the use of post-criminal conduct in professional and occupational initial licensure decision making
14.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove barriers to employment for individuals with criminal records who seek licensure or certification in an occupation governed by this article, with certain exceptions.Â Â

15.title: Supplementing, amending, decreasing, and increasing items from the State Road Fund to the Department of Transportation
15.description: The purpose of this bill is to supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, decrease, and increase items of appropriation in the aforesaid accounts for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2019.

16.last_action: On 3rd reading with right to amend, House Calendar
16.title: Supplementary appropriation to the Department of Transportation
16.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to add a new item of appropriation from the State Fund, General Revenue for the fiscal year 2019.

18.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to add new items and increase existing items of appropriation in the aforesaid accounts for the designated spending units for the fiscal year 2019.

19.title: Supplementing and amending Chapter 31, Acts of the Legislature, regular session, 2019, known as the budget bill

20.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Executive, Governor’s Office
20.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to transfer excess funds from the Unclaimed Property Fund to the State Fund, General Revenue, unappropriated surplus balance and making a supplemental appropriation for the fiscal year 2019.

25.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Department of Agriculture, Department of Agriculture Capital Improvements Fund
25.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and add an item of appropriation in the aforesaid accounts for the designated spending units for expenditure during the fiscal year 2020.

26.title: Supplementing and amending appropriations to the Department of Health and Human Resources, Division of Health – Central Office
26.description: The purpose of supplemental appropriation bill is to amend an item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending units for expenditure during the fiscal year 2020.

27.title: Supplementing, amending, increasing and adding new items of appropriations to the Executive, Attorney General, Consolidated Federal Fund
27.description: The purpose of supplemental appropriation bill is to expire supplement, amend, increase and add items of appropriation in the aforesaid accounts for the designated spending units for expenditure during the fiscal year 2020.

28.title: Supplementing and amending existing items of appropriations to the Department of Agriculture
28.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to decrease and increase existing items of appropriation in the aforesaid accounts for the designated spending units for the fiscal year 2020.

29.title: Relating to the admissibility of health care staffing requirements in medical professional liability litigation
29.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that meeting minimum staffing requirements in a health care facility includes the provision of adequate supervision.

30.last_action: On 3rd reading with right to amend, House Calendar
30.title: Increasing annual salaries of public school teachers and school service personnel
30.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the salaries for public school teachers and school service personnel by five percent.

31.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform A
31.title: Increasing the amount that a faculty senate of a public school may allocate to a classroom
31.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize a mathematics teacher incentive, reforms the Underwood-Smith programs and increases the amount that a faculty senate of a public school may allocate to a classroom teacher or librarian for academic materials, supplies or equipment which, in the judgment of the teacher or librarian, will assist providing instruction.

32.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform B
32.title: Authorizing a study of student loan payments tax credits and a loan forgiveness program for teachers
32.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize studies of issues effecting public school education including a study of student loan payments tax credits, a loan forgiveness program for teachers and a study of class sizes.

33.title: Supplementary appropriation to the Department of Health and Human Resources, Division of Health – Central Office
33.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide $3 million for 10 pilot projects or five years in hospitals and doctor’s offices across the state, funding Drug Free Mother Baby projects, which cut the rate of children who are born to addicted mothers.

34.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform D
34.title: Restoring local public school flexibility
34.description: The purpose of this bill is to restore local public-school flexibility by (1) reforming local school improvement councils; and (2) reforming the school innovation zone act to increase flexibility and decrease bureaucracy.

35.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform A
35.title: Authorizing a competitive grant program to implement vocational-technical education programs
35.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize a competitive grant program to implement vocational-technical education programs in middle schools.

36.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform A
36.title: Providing a bonus for teachers willing to teach in certain critical needs areas
36.description: 10.0pt;color:windowtext'>The purpose of this bill is to encourage additional teachers to teach in critical needs areas of math, science and special education by authorizing bonuses. The bill would increase the state minimum salary of special education teachers and teachers of mathematics and computer science in grades 7 through 12 by $2,000. The teacher must be fully certified with the appropriate programmatic level and specialization recognized on his or her professional license.Â

37.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform D
37.title: Relating to school calendar and testing
37.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the school calendar and testing; to require students to take achievement tests; and to exempt students who test at certain level from attending school past a certain instructional days.

38.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform A
38.title: Relating to modifications to the school aid formula
38.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the school aid formula, amend the definition of levies for general current expense purposes; institute a floor of 1,400 students for the purposes of determining the county’s basic foundation program;Â provide for allocating state aid share of certain counties by calculating the basic foundation program upon the 2015-2016 determined local share; and increase funding for alternative education programs.

39.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform A
39.title: Increasing the basic foundation allowance to the county for professional student support personnel
39.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the basic foundation allowance to the county for professional student support personnel.

40.title: West Virginia Business Ready Sites Program
40.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Business Ready Sites Program, which would provide for the Development Office to designate industrial sites for installation of utilities to make them more attractive for businesses to locate within West Virginia.

41.title: West Virginia Fairness in Competitive Bidding Act
41.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit work performed as part of disaster mitigation or recovery originating from a declared state of preparedness or state of emergency be contracted out on an open-ended basis.

42.title: Establishing and funding of substance use disorder treatment and recovery facilities
42.description: The purpose of this bill is to infuse additional resources into the Ryan Brown Fund and create greater flexibility in that fund for purposes beyond for long-term beds such as recovery housing and other SUD related service models that may exist.

43.title: Creating a pilot program to encourage utility infrastructure development to certain lands
43.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a pilot program to encourage public utilities to establish connections to potential sites for industrial development through favorable rate-setting and cost-recoupment provisions.

45.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Executive, Governor’s Office, Civil Contingent Fund
45.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is appropriate funds in the aforesaid account from the State Fund, General Revenue for the fiscal year 2019.

46.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Department of Revenue, Office of the Secretary, Home Rule Board Operations Fund
46.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement, amend, and add an item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2020.

47.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Department of Arts, Culture and History, Division of Culture and History, Lottery Education Fund
47.description: The purpose of supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement existing items of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2020.Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â

48.title: Making a supplementary appropriation by adding a new item and increasing the expenditure to the Department of Revenue, State Budget Office
48.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to add a new item of appropriation in the aforesaid account from the State Fund, General Revenue, for the fiscal year 2019.

49.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Department of Health and Human Resources, Division of Health, Central Office
49.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is appropriate funds in the aforesaid account from the State Fund, General Revenue, unappropriated surplus balance and making a supplemental appropriation for the fiscal year 2019.

50.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Department of Transportation, Division of Highways
50.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to increase an existing item of appropriation from the State Fund, General Revenue for the fiscal year 2019.

51.title: Supplementing, amending and increasing an item from the State Road Fund to the Department of Transportation, Division of Highways
51.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to supplement and increase an item of appropriation in the aforesaid account for the designated spending unit for expenditure during the fiscal year 2020.

52.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Department of Environmental Protection, Division of Environmental Protection
52.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is appropriate funds in the aforesaid account from the State Fund, General Revenue, unappropriated surplus balance and making a supplemental appropriation for the fiscal year 2019.

53.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Department of Military Affairs and Public Safety, Division of Homeland Security and Emergency Management
53.description: The purpose of this supplemental appropriation bill is to appropriate funds in the aforesaid account from the State Fund, General Revenue, for the fiscal year 2019.

54.title: Improving education by requiring the state board to establish rules for student accountability regarding performance
54.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for student accountability for the results of the statewide comprehensive assessment program.Â

55.title: Relating to information technology access for the blind and visually impaired
55.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal an entire article and to reenact the provisions of the article into a new section of the code within the appropriate chapter for state purchasing requirements and procedures.

56.title: Ron Yost Personal Assistance Services Act
56.description: The purpose of this bill is to move provisions from two articles under the Educations chapter of the West Virginia to a more appropriate location within the chapter for Public Health. The two current articles in Chapter 18 are to be repealed and then enacted as new articles within Chapter 16.

57.title: Removing or revising obsolete, outdated, antiquated, inoperative, surplus or superseded provisions of code related to the School Building Authority
57.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove or revise obsolete, outdated, antiquated, inoperative, surplus or superseded provisions of code related to the School Building Authority.

58.title: Removing antiquated, redundant, or expired provisions of the code for the administration of education
58.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove sections of the West Virginia Code, or portions of some sections, which contain antiquated, redundant, or outdated requirements for the administration of education in West Virginia.

59.title: Removing sections of code relating to administration of education
59.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove sections of the West Virginia Code, or portions of some sections, which contain antiquated, redundant, or outdated requirements for the administration of education in West Virginia.

60.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform A
60.title: Creating a grant program to improve local education agency efforts to train K-12 students to write and develop computer software programs
60.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a grant program for qualified educational organizations to teach coding and computer science.

61.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform A
61.title: Relating to public school support funding
61.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the school aid formula to allow for a greater number of counselors and other professional support personnel in county schools.

62.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform A
62.title: Relating to school calendar
62.description: The purpose of this bill is to revise the law relating to school calendars to provide local school boards greater flexibility in designing their calendars and scheduling instructional days.

63.title: Allowing a tax credit purposes for certain expenses paid by parent or legal guardian of student in providing private or home school
63.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a personal income tax exemption of up to $3,000 per year to parent or legal guardians of a student for expenses incurred in providing private or home school pre-K through 12 education for the student.

64.title: Establishing the West Virginia Equal Opportunity Education Scholarship program
64.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the West Virginia Equal Opportunity Education Scholarship program to provide tax credits for eligible contributions made to an authorized scholarship-granting organization, an educational improvement grant organization, public school district, and public school foundation that assists students in paying for education related expenses.

65.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform B
65.title: Relating to modifications to federal adjusted income for qualified education expenses
65.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a personal income tax exemption of up to $3,000 per year to parent or legal guardians of a student for expenses incurred in providing private or home school pre-K through 12 education for the student.

66.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform B
66.title: Relating to student transfers
66.description: The purpose of this bill is to define new policies and criteria for the transfer of students from one school district to another.

67.title: Relating to tax exemption for certain school supplies, school instructional materials, laptop and tablet computers, and sports equipment
67.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a four-day sales tax holiday during which certain items of clothing, school supplies, school instructional materials, laptop and tablet computers, and sports equipment are exempt from sales and use taxes.

68.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform B
68.title: Extending the length of time for the special Community-Based Pilot Demonstration Project to Improve Outcomes for At-Risk Youth
68.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend the length of time for the special Community-Based Pilot Demonstration Project to Improve Outcomes for At-Risk Youth.

69.title: Providing an annual cost-of-living increase for retired teachers and service personnel
69.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an annual cost-of-living increase in the amount of $2,000 for retired teachers and service personnel.

70.title: Increasing and promoting school innovation and flexibility
70.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase and promote school innovation and flexibility; define Innovation School; set forth responsibilities for Innovation Schools; allow Innovation Schools to solicit and accept gifts to use in support of Innovation School; require state board to promulgate rule setting forth application process to receive Innovation School; require an Innovation School plan; set forth required contents of Innovation School plan; set forth evaluation process for Innovation Schools; specify action that may be taken following Innovation School evaluation; create the Innovation School Fund; provide an avenue for flexibility for high performing schools; and clarify that this article does not affect prior Innovation Zone or Innovation in Education designations.

71.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform B
71.title: Relating to personal leave for county board of education employees
71.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a minimum level of personal leave for county board of education employees and to compensate employees when personal leave is not taken.

72.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform B
72.title: Relating to powers, duties, membership and meetings of local school improvement councils
72.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify and streamline the authority and procedures for local school improvement councils to propose alternatives to the operation of their schools including requesting of waivers to rules, policies, interpretations and state statutes. The bill also enhances the powers, duties and membership of the councils, particularly those at comprehensive middle and high schools. It requires the councils to hold at least one meeting annually for a dialogue with parents and others on the school’s academic performance and standing and illicit suggestions. The local school improvement council of a low performing school will be required to meet with the county board to address this dialogue with the parents and others. The requirement for the council to meet annually on student discipline issues and report to the countywide council on productive and safe schools is removed.

73.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform B
73.title: Creating a pilot program for expansion of school-based mental health and school-based diversion
73.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a pilot program to establish school-based mental and behavioral health services for students and families as an alternative to the standard disciplinary measures.

74.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform C
74.title: Relating to employment of individuals to teach elective courses
74.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit noncertified individuals with relevant qualifications to teach one elective course per semester.Â

75.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform C
75.title: Increasing basic state aid of school systems with low local resources per student
75.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the basic state aid of county school systems to the county’s full basic foundation program amount if the county’s local share is 18% or less.

76.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform C
76.title: Relating to school board levy rates
76.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify regular school board levy rates and allow county boards of education to increase their regular levy rates to the statutory maximum.

77.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform C
77.title: Education Adequacy Cost Study
77.description: The purpose of this bill is to direct the State Board of Education to facilitate a study on whether public school funding is sufficient to achieve adequate educational outcomes under the state mandate to provide a thorough an efficient education across the state; and providing time lines for submission of the report to the Legislature.

78.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform C
78.title: Relating to the special community development school pilot program
78.description: The purpose of this bill is to make certain reforms to the special community development pilot program.

79.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform C
79.title: Creating an after school grant program
79.description: The purpose of this bill is to create an after school program grant system.

81.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform C
81.title: Authorizing the right of collective bargaining and the right to strike to teachers and school service personnel
81.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant the right of collective bargaining and the right to strike to teachers and school service personnel.

82.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform C
82.title: Expanding Mountaineer Challenge Academy at its existing location and to a new location subject to agreement required under federal law
82.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Governor to expand Mountaineer Challenge Academy at its existing location and to a new location subject to agreement required under federal law.

83.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform C
83.title: Establishing the Summer Feeding for All initiative
83.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the Summer Feeding for All initiative that will encourage county school systems to look for innovative ways to provide assistance to students in need to access nutritious foods during summer break and other times when school is not in session; requiring each county school board to conduct an assessment of the availability of food to students to determine what food insecurities exist in the student population; directing each county school board compile and distribute a list of existing food providers in the community that will provide nutritious food to children with food insecurities on nonschool days; and directing the Office of Child Nutrition to help facilitate county school boards coordinate and develop the public policy initiative of Feed to Achieve.

84.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform C
84.title: Funding for professional student support services
84.description: The purpose of this bill is to revise the school aid formula allowance for professional student support personnel and law enforcement officers for schools.

85.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform C
85.title: Modifying regular school board levy rates
85.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify regular school board levy rates.

86.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform C
86.title: Increasing salaries for teachers
86.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase salaries for teachers; grant additional experiences for purposes of pay scale to math teachers meeting specified requirements; and increase salaries of school service personnel.

87.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform C
87.title: Relating to exemptions from mandated immunizations
87.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide exemptions from mandatory immunizations.

88.title: Removing certain fees for teaching
88.description: The purpose of this bill is to encourage out-of-state educational professionals to apply and work in West Virginia by removing certificate fees.

89.last_action: Became law without Governor's signature - Senate Journal
89.title: Relating to a statewide school personnel job bank
89.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that the cost of benefits be included in a job posting.

90.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform D
90.title: Relating to the public school support program
90.description: The purpose of this bill is to expand the definition of “professional student support personnel”; increase the basic foundation allowance for professional student support personnel; provide that counties with less than 1,400 in net enrollment shall be considered to have 1,400 in net enrollment for the purposes of determining the county’s basic foundation program; modify definition of the adults that participate in vocation programs that may be included in net enrollment; and modify definition of “levies for general current expense purposes”.

91.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform D
91.title: Requiring designation of teacher certification examinations and passing scores be set by rule of the State Board of Education
91.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase teacher salaries; provide that certain math and special education teachers be considered to have three additional years of experience for the purposes of the salary schedule; remove definition of salary equity among the counties; remove requirement that Department of Education include in its budget request a request for funding sufficient to meet the objective of salary equity; add to exceptions to requirement that county salary schedules be uniform; permit a county board of education to base its reductions in force determinations on an individual’s qualifications as defined in county board policy; and increase salaries for service personnel.

92.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform D
92.title: Relating to the Underwood-Smith Teaching Scholars Program
92.description: The purpose of this bill is to reform the Underwood-Smith Teacher Scholarship program as the Underwood-Smith Teaching Scholars Program, modifying program purpose to target certain disciplines in geographic areas of critical need and changing the terms to qualify for an award and to satisfy award requirements.

93.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform D
93.title: Reforming the Underwood-Smith Teacher Loan Assistance Program into a new program
93.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the Teacher Education Loan Repayment Program to provide financial relief for teachers.

94.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform D
94.title: Exempting personal income earned by individuals working as teachers at primary and secondary schools from personal income tax
94.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt personal income earned by individuals working as teachers at primary and secondary schools from personal income tax.

95.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform D
95.title: Establishing a summer education and employment program for low income
95.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a summer education and learning for success program to assist under preforming low income high school students through summer employment and remedial instruction to prepare them for post-graduation employment, training or education;Â creates special revenue account to receive grants and state funding; directs the board to coordinate job availability with Workforce West Virginia and the state Department of Labor; and allows county school boards to establish a program.

96.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform D
96.title: Providing additional pay for certain teachers providing math instruction
96.description: The purpose of this bill is to foster a greater level of mathematics competence by requiring the state Department of Education to develop specialized mathematics course and to compensate teachers who successfully complete these courses.

97.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform D
97.title: Education expenses tax credits
97.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a personal tax credit for classroom teachers spending money on supplementary education supplies or professional development courses.

98.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform D
98.title: Establishing physical activity requirements in the schools
98.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that students be provided education and training in the areas of nutrient and structured exercise education.

99.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform B
99.title: The Experimental School Zone Act
99.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the establishment of experimental school zones and to provide for the evaluation of the performance of experimental curricula and policies.

100.last_action: To House Select Committee on Education Reform A
100.title: Eliminating the permit requirement for storing of a concealed handgun in a vehicle on school property
100.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the permit requirement for storing of a concealed handgun in a vehicle on school property for persons over 21.

101.title: Reducing compensation of legislators during the First Extraordinary Session of 2019
101.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce the pay of legislators for the first extraordinary session of 2019 following the 6th day of attendance.

103.title: Exempting from business and occupation tax certain merchant power plants
103.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt certain merchant power plants from the business and occupation tax.

104.title: Relating to residency, manager, and licensure requirements for West Virginia Alcohol Beverage Control Administration applicants and licensees
104.description: The purpose of this bill is to address the residency issue that was struck down under the Dormant Commerce Clause in Tennessee Wine and Spirits Retailers Assn. v. Russel F. Thomas, Executive Director of the Tennessee Alcoholic Beverage Commission, et al., No. 18-96 (U.S. June 26, 2019). While West Virginia does not have the same restrictions set forth in Tennessee, the WVABCA is revising its requirements to set forth manager requirements for all licensees requiring that the manager is readily available to address licensure and public health and safety issues with the WVABCA’s agents; WVDHHR is removing the residency requirements from the Medical Cannabis Act; and the WV Lottery is removing residency requirements.

105.title: Providing that work performed for recovery from a declared state of disaster or emergency is subject to competitive bidding
105.description: The purpose of this bill is provide that work performed for recovery from a declared state of disaster or state of emergency is to be considered as a government construction project subject to competitive bidding.

106.title: Supplementing and amending items of appropriation to Auditor’s Office, General Administration
106.description: The purpose of this bill is to appropriate additional money to the State Auditor’s Office out of available funds for the fiscal year ending June 30, 2020.
